# The `AAResultsWrapperPass` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A wrapper pass to provide the legacy pass manager access to a suitably prepared <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aaresults">AAResults</a> object. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

A wrapper pass to provide the legacy pass manager access to a suitably prepared <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aaresults">AAResults</a> object.

### getAnalysisUsage() {#abcb7db4473bd2451956a9b070a3dc9bf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void AAResultsWrapperPass::getAnalysisUsage (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/analysisusage">AnalysisUsage</a> &amp;) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
getAnalysisUsage - This function should be overriden by passes that need analysis information to do their job.

If a pass specifies that it uses a particular analysis result to this function, it can then use the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass/#a4863e5e463fb79955269fbf7fbf52b80">getAnalysis&lt;AnalysisType&gt;()</a> function, below.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h/#l00994">994</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h">AliasAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/aliasanalysis-cpp/#l00778">778</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/aliasanalysis-cpp">AliasAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### runOnFunction() {#a47ee17feac90f644d8afe91156ae9ddf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Function Alias Analysis true bool AAResultsWrapperPass::runOnFunction (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Run the wrapper pass to rebuild an aggregation over known <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a> passes.

This is the legacy pass manager&#39;s interface to the new-style <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a> results aggregation object. Because this is somewhat shoe-horned into the legacy pass manager, we hard code all the specific alias analyses available into it. While the particular set enabled is configured via commandline flags, adding a new alias analysis to LLVM will require adding support for it to this list.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h/#l00992">992</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h">AliasAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/aliasanalysis-cpp/#l00741">741</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/aliasanalysis-cpp">AliasAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
